alert.note: Alert for Benton; Morgan (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 5:45AM CDT until August 01 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Benton County in central Missouri... Morgan County in central Missouri... * Until 1000 AM CDT. * At 545 AM CDT, Local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Several reports of flooding were reported along Highway B south of Cole Camp. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Versailles, Village of Four Seasons, Cole Camp, Stover, Laurie, Gravois Mills, Crockerville, Zora, Florence, Rocky Mount and Lake of The Ozarks. This includes the following low water crossings... Archer Creek at Highway WW, Little Gravois Creek at Leatherman Lane, Big Buffalo Creek at Highway WW, Gabriel Creek at Highway BB, Williams Creek at Highway B and Rocky Ford Creek at Ritchey Road. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
